Comments_List: I learned how to work with papyri and how to navigate the Beinecke/Yale library resources.
Papyrological skills like script identification and dating. Also much useful knowledge about the calendar, economics, and daily life of Roman Egypt.
I now have familiarity with papyrology and more knowledge about Roman Egypt.

This course allows students to learn about papyri in a very hand-on way. I think the only way to learn about materials is to engage with them directly. This course allowed me the opportunity to do that.

Some of the later sessions without defined purposes felt undirected. Though it was very useful to go through our projects individually, we did that so much that I feel we could have had more units on e.g. learning more of the relevant history or more about identifying kinds of documents.
I would recommend this course to another student if that student wants the opportunity to work with ancient materials.
Yes. It was very difficult, but I learned a great deal, and it was relevant to my studies.
Yes, if they want an introduction to papyrology
